sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from metal supply stores or online metal vendors; Ga: Obtain from chemical suppliers or specialized online stores; Ni: Available at hardware stores or online; Tb: Sourced from chemical suppliers or rare earth element distributors.
steps: Co: Purchase from metal supply stores or online metal vendors; Ga: Obtain from chemical suppliers or specialized online stores; Ni: Available at hardware stores or online; Tb: Sourced from chemical suppliers or rare earth element distributors.

1. Weigh out 1.76 g of cobalt (Co). 2. Weigh out 4.65 g of gallium (Ga). 3. Weigh out 11.66 g of nickel (Ni). 4. Weigh out 6.00 g of terbium (Tb). 5. Place all ingredients in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle or ball mill to thoroughly mix the powders until uniform in appearance.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 1.76 g of cobalt (Co). 2. Weigh out 4.65 g of gallium (Ga). 3. Weigh out 11.66 g of nickel (Ni). 4. Weigh out 6.00 g of terbium (Tb). 5. Place all ingredients in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle or ball mill to thoroughly mix the powders until uniform in appearance.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the material to 900 °C (1652 °F) at a rate of 5 °C/min. 4. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the material to 900 °C (1652 °F) at a rate of 5 °C/min. 4. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally within the furnace (approximately 6-8 hours). 3. Do not open the furnace until it is at room temperature to prevent rapid cooling and cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally within the furnace (approximately 6-8 hours). 3. Do not open the furnace until it is at room temperature to prevent rapid cooling and cracking.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 3. Use sandpaper or a grinder to smooth out surfaces if necessary. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant if the material is to be exposed to air or moisture.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Carefully remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 3. Use sandpaper or a grinder to smooth out surfaces if necessary. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant if the material is to be exposed to air or moisture.
